key_points: Signal attempted to purchase Instagram ads highlighting Facebook's data collection practices.
The proposed ads would display the personal information Facebook uses for ad targeting.
Facebook allegedly responded by shutting down Signal's advertising account.
Signal's blog post criticized Facebook's preference for opaque data usage.
The blog includes examples of the types of ads Signal wanted to run.
Signal's CEO, Moxie Marlinspike, tweeted another ad example, emphasizing detailed targeting.
Facebook previously removed ads critical of the company, including those from Sen. Elizabeth Warren.
Facebook credits its ad business, reliant on data tracking, for its significant revenue growth.
Facebook has expressed concerns about Apple's privacy updates impacting its ad business.
The controversy around WhatsApp's terms of service changes highlighted the debate on personal data sharing.
